comments.text:
On Windows Xp...

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a file on your C:\ or a UNC path.
2. Remove read permissions from the file.
3. From an input form, try to select this file.

Actual Results:
The file can be selected.

Expected behaviour:
The file picker should give you an error and not allow you to select the unreadable file like it does on Windows 7.

Other info:

In Windows 7 filepicker, this is not a problem.  The OS gives you an error that it can't read from the file. 

I believe there is a message we can implement in the filepicker hook which will allow us to disallow the selection of files we can't read on Windows.

If you only add the file permissions after the file is selected, the form does not submit, so there is no separate error there.
